topic: How to containerize serverless handlers using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to containerize serverless handlers using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Containerizing Serverless Handlers using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to package and deploy serverless functions built with FastAPI as a part of a containerized application using Docker and Uvicorn ASGI server in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understand the basics of containerization, FastAPI, and Docker
Write a serverless function with FastAPI
Install required packages for building Docker images
Create a Dockerfile to package the application
Configure deployment on a cloud platform (optional)

code_examples.code:
fastapi new my_project
cd my_project
fastapi init --uvicorn

FROM python:3.12-slim
WORKDIR /app
COPY requirements.txt .
RUN pip install -r requirements.txt
COPY . .
CMD ["uvicorn", "main:app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "8000"]

version_notes: This guide is specifically written for Python 3.12+ and assumes the use of FastAPI version 0.74.0.
The Docker base image used is python:3.12-slim.
caveats: Ensure you have Docker installed on your system before following this guide
Replace `my_project` in the code examples with the name of your FastAPI project directory.
Modify the CMD command in the Dockerfile if using a different port or host.
Configure environment variables and service settings for deployment on a cloud platform as needed.
